property.name: Camera Prefix
property.description: Prefix used in naming convention of photographs taken

property.name: Photo Number
property.description: Photo Number

property.name: Associated material
property.description: Please describe associated material within the area of the hearth material

lookup.term: Egg shellEmu, genyornis or other eggshell
LacustrineLacustrine material (mussel shell or shell fragment, fish bone, otoliths, etc.)

property.name: Lacustrine Material
property.description: If lacustrine material is in or associated unambiguously with the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

property.name: Burnt lacustrine material
property.description: If lacustrine material is present in the hearth, is any of it burnt?

property.name: Associated terrestrial bone
property.description: If terrestrial bone is present in the hearth or unambiguously associated with it, select those of the following that have been identified (see Old Bone Reference Manual for more illustrations)

property.name: Burnt bone
property.description: If terrestrial bone is present in the hearth, is any of it burnt?

property.name: Associated eggshell
property.description: If eggshell is present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

property.name: Burnt eggshell
property.description: If eggshell is present in the hearth, is any of it burnt?

property.name: Associated artefacts
property.description: If stone artefacts are present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

property.name: CS types
property.description: If chipped stone is present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {cdeb}Flaking debris, including whole flakes, broken flakes and angular fragments

property.name: RU types
property.description: If retouched or utilised chipped stone is present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {fotherru}Any other type of artefact with retouch or use-wear

property.name: Unmod types
property.description: If unmodified stone is present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {cpebble}Small nodular or rounded piece, unlikely to be useful for artefact manufacture

property.name: Ground material
property.description: If ground stone is present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {bmuller}Convex surface with facet from back and forth motion
{dpestle}A cobble with convex of flattish ground end
{famorph}Poorly defined, or small, discontinuous ground surface, not matching any of the above
{gundiag}Fragmentary, not complete enough to distinguish nature of ground surface

property.name: Ground material status
property.description: Ground material status?

property.name: Artefact raw material
property.description: If stone artefacts are present in the hearth, select those types of raw material that have been observed

property.name: Other worked material
property.description: If other worked or transported material is present in the hearth, select those of the following that have been observed

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Hearth
ArchaeologicalElement.description: * In situ hearth * discrete surface cluster of hearthstones

property.name: ID
property.description: Hearth Identified, 4 digit code

property.name: Hearth Type
property.description: Type of hearth

lookup.term: {Heat_retainer}Hearths with heat-retainer hearthstones {ahsterm}Termite nest hearthstones (holes and channels visible) {bhscarb}Carbonate hearthstones {chsclay}Baked clay or sandy clay hearthstones {dhsother}Other type of hearthstones (e.g. silcrete) {ehsindet}Hearthstones of indeterminate material

{Non-heat_retainer}Hearths without hearthstones {aemupat}Discrete patch of baked sediments, associated with charcoal, organic remains, and/or ash {bbaked_clay}Discrete patch of baked clay, may be underlain by black stain, may or may not be associated with organic remains {cbakedsed}Discrete patch of baked sediment without associated charcoal or organic remains {dashlens} {eashpatch}Discrete patch containing fragmented or disseminated charcoal and/or ash {fcharclens}A discrete lens of charcoal fragments (rare) {gstaining}Black or dark staining of the sediment that does not correspond to any of the above {hother}A cluster of burnt material without clear hearth structure, eg fish bone, emu eggshell, mammal bone

property.name: Brief description
property.description: A few word description of an ‘other’ type of hearth or hearthstone, e.g. fish hearth, emu eggshell hearth, silcrete hearthstones

property.name: Charcoal
property.description: Is there any charcoal associated with the hearth, if so, in what form?

lookup.term: {bdissem}Disseminated charcoal: fine particles of charcoal dispersed through the hearth feature or its sedimentary matrix
{cflecks}Small fragments of charcoal dispersed through the hearth feature or its sedimentary matrix
{dlumps}Fragments or lumps of charcoal occur within the hearth or its sedimentary matrix

property.name: Degree in situ
property.description: Select the proportion of visible hearth material that remains in situ

lookup.term: {amost}Most of the visible hearth material is in situ
{bsome}At least some of the hearth is in situ
{csurface}No hearth material is embedded in sediment
{drecement}The hearth material appears to be in situ, but there is a high likelihood that it is actually cemented in redeposited sediment
{eambig}The hearth material appears to be in situ, but it is impossible to say whether it is actually recemented

property.name: Has modification
property.description: Does the hearth been modified?

property.name: Modification of heat retainer hearths?
property.description: Have heat retainer hearths been modified?

lookup.term: {bdispers}Material widely dispersed from in situ or clustered part of hearth

property.name: Modification of non heat retainer hearths?
property.description: Have non heat retainer hearths been modified?

lookup.term: {aweather}Hearth material has started to weather and/or crumble, but the feature remains largely intact
{bincrill}Incipient rill network extending to edge of hearth or cutting back into it
{crill}Well-developed rills are cutting through the hearth
{dundercut}Underlying sediment has been removed through erosion
{egul}Feature is bisected by an established gully

property.name: Topo setting
property.description: Where on the lunette exposure is the hearth located?

lookup.term: {frillfloor}In the floor of a deep rill (strong, vertical rilling in clay-rich sediments)
{grillwall}In the wall of a deep rill (strong, vertical rilling in clay-rich sediments)
{hridge}On a narrow ridge in heavily eroded area
{iridgerill}Feature in a heavily eroded area is cut by deep rills and straddles rill wall and rill flow
{jshalgulfl}In the floor of a gully less than 1.5m wide or deep
{kshalgulwal}In the wall of a gully less than 1.5m wide or deep
{ldeepgulfl}In the floor of a gully greater than 1.5m wide and deep
{mdeepgulwal}In the wall of a gully greater than 1.5m wide and deep
{nresidtop}Flat surface on top of a residual
{pchanfloor}In the floor of a modern outwash channel
{qchanwall}In the wall of a modern outwash channel

property.name: Sediments
property.description: What is the surrounding sediment?

lookup.term: {ewhitesand}Sandy sediments that are clean and whitish
{fothersand}Sandy sediments that are of another colour
{mcobble}A relatively continuous bed of cobbles or coarse gravel
{ngglag}A surface lag of carbonate derived from Golgol sediments
{ocarblag}Any other surface lag of hard carbonate nodules
{pggC}In situ soil carbonate (C-horizon) associated with Golgol sediments
{qChorizon}In situ nodular soil carbonate in any other sediment
{rcarbsoft}In situ soil carbonate in a diffuse horizon
{scarbpavemt}Well developed in situ soil carbonate forming a pavement
{tcarbrework}A carbonate lag that has been reworked and reburied

property.name: Vulnerability
property.description: How vulnerable is the feature?

lookup.term: {alow}On a relatively stable, flat surface or gentle slope that is not being eroded by rills, in well cemented (firm) sediment
{bmoderate}Wider area is being eaten away by ongoing erosion, e.g. near edge of platform exposure, gully head, expanding rill system
{chigh}High probability of material being removed by erosion, or of the hearth losing its integrity, e.g. relatively steep slope with incipient rills and/or in loose sandy sediment
{dextreme}Hearth material is in imminent danger of rapid removal and loss, e.g. edge of eroding residual or deep rill, in gully wall, on a steep slope- washed surface, or in loose sandy sediment

property.name: Palaeotop setting
property.description: Select from the list what the feature palaeotopographic setting is.

lookup.term: {aforedune}Stratigraphic layers are sloping towards the lakebed
{bbackdune}Stratigraphic layers are sloping towards the hinterland
{cbeach}An area of rounded cobbles or gravels in distinct horizon
{ecrest}Crest of dune, stratigraphic layers slope away, towards both lakebed and hinterland

property.name: Types of Photographs taken
property.description: What kinds of pics were taken?

property.name: Photos
property.description: An image of approx. 200 pixels wide used to represent the record in search results and other compact listings
